blocks.text: Consider a small strip of width $dx$, distant $x$ from the apex (Fig. 73).
The area of the strip = $x \cdot dx$, and thus its volume = $y \cdot x \cdot dx$.
So that the mass of the strip
$m = \rho \cdot V = \frac{y}{x} \cdot y \cdot x \cdot dx = y^2 \cdot dx.$
The first moment of the strip about O is
$\frac{1}{2} \cdot m \cdot x = \frac{1}{2} \cdot y^2 \cdot dx \cdot x = \frac{1}{2} \cdot y^2 \cdot x dx.$
